instrupy.basic_sensor_model.BasicSensorModel¶

class instrupy.basic_sensor_model.BasicSensorModel(name=None, mass=None, volume=None, power=None, orientation=None, fieldOfViewGeometry=None, sceneFieldOfViewGeometry=None, maneuver=None, pointingOption=None, dataRate=None, syntheticDataConfig=None, bitsPerPixel=None, numberDetectorRows=None, numberDetectorCols=None, _id=None)[source]¶

A basic sensor model class.

Variables

  • name (str) – Full name of the instrument.

  • mass (float) – Total mass (kg) of this instrument.

  • volume (float) – Total volume (m3) of this instrument.

  • power (float) – Nominal operating power (W) of this instrument.

  • orientation (instrupy.util.Orientation) – Orientation of the instrument.

  • fieldOfView (instrupy.util.ViewGeometry) – Field of view of instrument specification (SphericalGeometry and Orientation).

  • sceneFieldOfView – Scene field of view specification (SphericalGeometry and Orientation).

  • maneuver (instrupy.util.Maneuver) – Maneuver specification of the instrument.

  • fieldOfRegard (list, instrupy.util.ViewGeometry) – Field of regard of the instrument taking into account the sceneFOV and manueverability of the satellite-sensor system. Note that this shall be a list in order to accommodate non-intersecting view-geometries. TODO: Modify behavior to have FOR = sceneFOV when no maneuver is specified (hence fixed pointing). Currently FOR = None if manuever is not specified.

  • pointingOption (list, orbitpy.util.Orientation) – List of Orientation objects which specify the orientations into which the instrument-axis can be maneuvered. The orientations must be specified in the NADIR_POINTING frame.

  • dataRate (float) – Rate of data recorded (Mega bits per sec) during nominal operations.

  • syntheticDataConfig (instrupy.util.SyntheticDataConfiguration) – Synthetic data configuration for the instrument.

  • bitsPerPixel (int) – Number of bits encoded per pixel of image.

  • numberDetectorRows (int) – Number of detector rows (along the Y-axis of the SENOR_BODY_FIXED frame). If the SENSOR_BODY_FIXED frame is aligned to the NADIR_POINTING frame, this direction corresponds to the along-track direction.

  • numberDetectorCols (int) – Number of detector columns (along the X-axis of the SENOR_BODY_FIXED frame). If the SENSOR_BODY_FIXED frame is aligned to the NADIR_POINTING frame, this direction corresponds to the cross-track direction.

  • _id (str or int) – Unique instrument identifier.
